column4: is it practical to run the netbook remix on a laptop that isn't a netbook?
for what purpose?
it supposedly has a kernel optimised for the atom processor.
its a smaller notebook that i only really use for the internet and to write small documents
unless you want the odd desktop it has, i would just use ubuntu with openbox or lubuntu.
but again it depends on what you're trying to achieve? low power ?
battery life would be a plus
the system runs win 7 at the moment, so if that will give me better life i might as well stick to it
Im not sure how good my netbook is with power and windows7 as i removed it five minutes after unwrapping the thing. although i assume you're familiar with the power monitor graphs etc ?
power monitor graphs?
yeah, screenshots incoming....
uploading.
er you still there?
try this : https://www.dropbox.com/photoshow/screenshots/ubuntu-9.10-power-monitor/power-manager-wakeups.png <click full size>
thanks i have to make an account, one sec
not to view it surely?
yea unfortunately, and now that i have it seems to be pointing me to that directory stucture in my account, which is of course empty
here : public link : http://www.dropbox.com/gallery/180039/2/screenshots/ubuntu-9.10-power-monitor?h=1d9252
okay that works, thanks a ton. sorry for the inconvenience
hmm, thanks, i guess ill do a dual boot system with ubuntu and win 7 and see what performs better for my needs on this laptop
yeah might be the only way you'll find out .. note that if you try to assess it via isb live disk that the usb disk will be using extra power.
yea ill do an install to hard disk
